conclusion: To determine the work done by the external environment on the gas during the process from C to A, analyze the given p-V diagram and apply thermodynamics.
The process from C to A is a vertical line on the p-V diagram, indicating constant volume and changing pressure.
The process from C to A is an isochoric (constant volume) process.
For an isochoric process, the work done W is given by the integral of p dV.
Since the volume is constant during the process from C to A, dV = 0, so the work done W is 0.
The work done by the external environment on the gas during the process from C to A is zero.
